author: hungryproton
title: Procedural 3D assets generator
description: Video games requiring real-time 3D procedural generation have almost no options available, especially free and open source.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to deliver a opensource Game engine that can be used by game developers to generated game assets. The proposal is very generic and if it was not mentioned that it is used by a team in a different, but specific game development proposal for Cardano I would not see how this is related to Cardano. It is opensource, at a very reasonable budget and produces software that others can use for designing games on Cardano. Due to its generic nature I can not give full marks as it could have been as well funded by any other blockchain and Cardano devs would be able to use it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is very passionate about this topic which shows from the detail that he describes the nuances of running on different operating systems and where possible bugs can appear. He is asking for 8k for part time compensation for 2 people and consultants to fix bugs that they can't. The software already exists to the point that it is being used by other proposals in Fund8 and the proposer knows the underlying game engine (Godot) well, having spent 13 years working with it. The idea is narrated from purely technical angle and lacks the selling points - it looks to be a case of a good idea, written badly. For this reason I suspect it was not funded in fund7 as the proposer himself described. The key takeaway is that it is game engine that generates assets for game designers in Cardano (that other blockchains can use as well), the funds being asked for are very reasonable and there is concrete plan how to deliver broken down by month and actions for each of the months. I suggest that next time the proposer reaches out to community advisors early in the proposal stage to check that the proposal is structured effectively for a non technical reader
f6_assessments.q2: There is a clear deliverable and a detailed 3 month plan with activities delineated for each of the months. There will be a github repo where progress can be monitored and the success will be tested by creating a small city with assets and that will cover 80% of the complexity that you can find in the video game (the 80% is an estimate from the proposer
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks, Gilles is indeed very passionate about his heart project!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer would like to refactor and improve an already existing software for procedural content generation. While the proposal is sound and technically understandable, there might be a problem with the challenge setting: The Challenge is about building the Cardano-Ecosystem, which is not strictly the case with this proposal. The proposer claims that his solution could be used within the cardano-community (eg. Metaverse projects) – which is indeed correct, but the Cardano-Community does not benefit from the proposal much more than anybody else doing something with 3d. There is a connection to an existing Cardano-Project (Aedou: Realm of language), in which the proposer is involved, and they are using the tool of the proposer. The impact is therefor rather specialized and minor regarding the whole cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has the required skills to complete this proposal. The budget is reasonable, and the timeline might be realistic. Without deeper inside it is hard to determine the amount of work required, but the proposer obviously has the experience and a clear understanding what must be done.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is mostly clear, and the goal seems to be achievable. Being an open-source project hosted on Github the progress can be observed. The goal of a working version, able to generate a small-scale city is also relatively good defined. The proposer admits that not every step can be clearly defined in advance which is understandable. With the time and effort already invested there is a high degree of confidence that the proposer will complete the proposal as defined.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the feedback! Aedou is a high impact project, so the use of this proposal for Cardano would be especially high if it makes its implementation possible. Also, lots of people in the Cardano ecosystem would benefit a ton from stronger open source 3D capacities.

f6_assessments.q0: There are already game engines available as open source to get budding game developers the tooling to start "on a shoestring". Not just Godot which is given as an example in the proposal. A free and easy way to support game creation with 3D assets is however missing, and the proposal fills exactly that niche. So despite being quite niche and on the verge of being "only" useful for Gamers On-Chained or some comparable category, I see this as a very impactful way to support open source contribution and gaming on Cardano in general. What is very important is to not just make this about gaming per se, but gaming on Cardano. So in order to qualify for the challenge requirement that future Catalyst efforts benefit from the proposal, this could have received more elaboration from the proposers. Otherwise I am confident that the already existing engagement on Github and Youtube with the prototype/alpha/ product will ensure that we see an increase in the number and the quality of Cardano projects and contributors thanks to this open source project.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility assessment is making good use of all the recommended tools, like roadmap, budget breakdown, discussion of goals and how they relate to timeframe and costs. This is a previously unfunded proposal and the Feasibility section has been improved a lot to give confidence that the project can be completed successfully. The links to Github and Youtube prove that this project has been going on for a while and has produced credible progress and quality. I think it is likely that the proposers can continue on this path successfully and hope that they are genuine about making Cardano blockchain gaming the core of the development should they get funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided under Feasibility is referred to under Auditability. This is okay, but a discussion of the performance metrics or Github data against that roadmap discussed in this section would have been better and added a layer or transparency and auditability to the proposal. Creating "a city" as a 3-D project as a demonstration of the success of the proposal is a bit unusual and may lack granularity, but it quite ambitious and should provide auditors together with the roadmap a good idea as it literally "cannot be built in a day".
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the feedback, enjoyed the anecdote to the construction of Rome. :)

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposals strives to grow a free open source project that deals with 3d assests generation. I remember this project in the previous fund, because I liked it but it simply wasn't up to the standars and didn't provide enough information, but let me say this is not the case for this funding round. I am very excited about this proposal and seeing the proposer comming again this funding round with the same and improved proposal really is a joy. This proposal fits into the challenge setting perfectly as It's an open source project. It's clear that this project will bring one more piece to the puzzle of the cardano ecosystem.
The project is alredy up and running and has some adoption already. Considering the type of the project these are already two very good reasons for anyone to support it. As a developer myself I need to say yes to refactoring. For those of you not tech oriented, refactoring is the process of rewriting code so it's more maintainable, and for any open source project that is key in order for any project to grow, because with a lot of people contributing the code needs to be understandable. The fact the proposal follows the linux ideology of 'do one thing, but do it well' really resonates with me and this would be a building block for many project including NFT ones and I believe it's just a matter of time.
As a developer I'm really excited for this project and I will vote for it and recommend you do too!
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided all the necessary links meaning github profile and already built project and has a video explaining how the engine works. One of the things you do as a CA is see if the proposal has real people doing real work and I have no doubt the proposer is a proffectional that knows what he's doing with seemingly bettered proposal skills as well. The budget is clear and at hourly rate of 11$ it's an amazing project to support. The proposer has a clear view on what needs to be done, as well as the technical skillset to do it. I really like the way this project and repository have evolved over the past 3-4 months since I last looked at it, this shows me the dedication and continuous work done on this project. 
The technical parts of the proposal are really well explained and I'm really impressed by the foundational way of doing safe scaling. It's not something you see too often in practice. There's a clear implementation path and plan to folow and the release cycles are often gathering feedback and moving on, which is the definition of agile development.
All these factors bring a lot of credibility to the project and makes it more than feasible! Really god job on the proposal this fund and I commend you for your persistance and growth!
f6_assessments.q2:
There's a github repo. I could just end here and give it 5/5 because for a project to really be auditable and have a place when people can go look on what the progress is and what's happening there needs to be a single source of truth and in the developing world github (where the code is) is that place. Creating a small city is more than impressive because it has many parts and is complicated.
The proposer offers a clear problem and a partially implemented already solution which is the best way of getting funded. Overall this is a good proposal and even more important a proposal that can be easily audited.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the warm and insightful feedback, it is very much appreciated!! We put in more effort this time to show why it might be useful for lots of people here.

f6_assessments.q0: By watching the first 2 minutes of the video, I’m amazed by how much would this impact into Cardano open source ecosystem. Not only it will help creator, but ease the landscape for people who wanted to make procedural 3D assets on Cardano (Game, NFT, etc). The idea for open source is so that the community could add and enhance the functionality of this program, which will scale with further community engagement. However, this proposal didn’t include the reason on why this is important to improve Cardano community. As I said before, it can benefit the creator who build NFT or other similar project on Cardano. It would be great if the proposal could provide how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem with this procedural 3D assets generator.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer able to provide working product with ProtonGraph, shown through Github repo and demo video on provided YouTube link. The roadmap is also provided with goals and description for each month, such as Porting the core software from Godot version 3 to version 4, etc. This proves that the proposer knows the technical detail and how to work with this technology. Although the requested fund is relatively small compared to other proposals in this challenge (note that this challenge have $1.2 million allocation budget), the budgeting detail is still lacking. Providing info on the expected work hour for the month or week, with salary per hour is a good start. Refer to this proposal for a decent budgeting breakdown example (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/401709). Other than that, overall this is well written proposal which provides necessary information for how this project will progress and work.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provides a clear roadmap and goals for each month. The metrics and KPIs is provided, however there aren’t any set of ‘target number or parameters description’ other than the general objective itself; such as: “..publish a working version of ProtonGraph able to generate a small city procedurally”. Explain further what is considered as a “small city procedurally”, as it can be interpreted with many different parameters. Other than that, Github link and repo is provided, so it will be publicly accessible and the community could track the progress and development.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the detailed feedback! We did not think to detail more possible interactions, as most of it is designed for game capacity and will bring great value to all Cardano game devs. The NFTzation of generated assets is a different step that does not need to be included in the solution.

solution: ProtonGraph is a FOSS software enabling easy 3D content generation for everyone, even for non-technical people.
experience:
I started game development as a hobby 13 years ago, and then I became a software engineer.

I created ProtonGraph while making several open source tools for the Godot engine (the tech behind ProtonGraph) over the last 3 years, so I know this stack really well.
